text: date: thu 01/27/2000 12:22 pm from: youremailid (youremail@lmco.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: opening doors for womenis this not sexual discrimination? ("springboard for women's biz," 27.jan.2000). the fact that they are opening the funding only to women owned businesses is discriminatory. it is no different than offering a managerial position and only opening the applications to men. i for one am tired of the double standard that infects the business world. you should give equal opportunity to any entrepreneur and give funding based on a nondiscriminatory basis. how can this country ever expect to be fair and just when you have programs such as these that are eliminating people from consideration based entirely on the basis of gender or race or even age? programs like these are unjust and should be illegal. if they want to help entrepreneurs they should help them all, don
